title: I'm Serbian living in Stockholm. How can I convince my Bosnian neighbors that Radovan Karadzic was not a war criminal and there was no genocide in Srebrenica? - Quora

response.answer_text: I'm Serbian living in Stockholm. How can I convince my Bosnian neighbors that Radovan Karadzic was not a war criminal and there was no genocide in Srebrenica? If, as a Serb, you have nothing better than to harass and try to convince your Bošniak neighbor of a Serbian lecture of his own antagonist historical beliefs, you have quite some face. This, non withstanding what is true and what is not. Surprising then, that you can have such face… face to face with your neighbor, and yet ask the question as an anonymous on Quora, where no one will be able, obviously, to punch your face. That contradictions leaves me very suspicious on you being who you pretend to be. That suspicion is reinforced by a few other elements : you define yourself as “Serbian” and not “Serb” (that happens at time on Quora),but more weirdly, you confuse “Bošniak” with Bosnian (that last part is typically Clintonian propaganda, Bosnian is a nationality, not an ethnicity and no Serb will make the confusion ; so is Serbian by the way).So, in my opinion, OP, you’re just either a trashy Ottoman leftover who’s trying to launch a curved ball through a Quora question in order for some public vindication to fall on the Serbs, either an even more trashy Westerner who should read a bit more and write a bit less. In any case, you don’t the basic requirements to do so though : a mastery of the Serbian alphabet (it’s Karadžić, not Karadzic, idiot), or local ethnonyms, and of simple logics which the conjunction of your question and anonymity undoubtedly betray.

You can try to argue, but I wouldn’t bother as people nowadays redefine words to suit their argument and then refuse to acknowledge they’ve done so. Different conflict (I don’t know a lot about the conflict in the Balkans during the early 90’s, other than it was basically fighting over very old grievances, I’m sorry), but I’ve basically given up on trying to explain that, although I’m opposed to the Zionist rule in Israel and their expansion tactics, I can’t really fault them in dealing with the Palestinian insurgence. Saying “you can’t come within x-number of metres of our military patrols or we’ll shoot you.” and then shooting people who come closer anyway is not genocide. The Palestinians deliberately not clearing combat zones of civilians, even though they’re officially at war with Israel, is not the Israeli’s fault, etc… but it just bounces off of these people who fall hook, line and sinker for these victim tactics, because they want to pretend to be better humans than me. Therefore, when I see misinformed opinions nowadays, I pause, breathe and move on. I just don’t have the energy to waste on people who refuse to look at events objectively.
